oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Campbell Chapel AME: interior
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Campbell Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Church

This black and white photograph of a church interior was taken from rear of room. Pews line both sides of a center aisle. The front of room has choir pews, wood railing, and a lecturn with a microphone and cloth dressing. Behind the pulpit are three bishops chairs. The back wall has the American flag and church flag flanking the bishops chairs; a large cross is on the wall between two pointed arch windows.

Named in honor of of Bishop J.P. Campbell of the AME conference, Campbell Chapel was the first AME congregation in Giles County. It was established in 1925 in Pulaski, TN, and has since established a reputation for community leadership among African Americans there.
